content.raw:
Instead of merging, I used `hg graft` to apply individal commits from the chosen pull requests.  That seems to have done the right thing.  The changes are on the new `gazebo_1.2` branch, which Jenkins is [testing now](http://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-gazebo_1.2-devel-precise-amd64/).

Once I get a clean test result, I'll release 1.2.6 from `gazebo_1.2`.  Future 1.2 releases will also come from that branch.

As an aside, Nate will merge `dev` onto `default` and we'll start developing 1.3 there.  When that's done, `dev` will go away.  We'll do new development on `default` and create a branch for each major.minor release series.
content.html:
Instead of merging, I used hg graft to apply individal commits from the chosen pull requests. That seems to have done the right thing. The changes are on the new gazebo_1.2 branch, which Jenkins is testing now.

Once I get a clean test result, I'll release 1.2.6 from gazebo_1.2. Future 1.2 releases will also come from that branch.

As an aside, Nate will merge dev onto default and we'll start developing 1.3 there. When that's done, dev will go away. We'll do new development on default and create a branch for each major.minor release series.
